metadata.title: CVE-2024-26834 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:netfilter: nft_flow_offload: release dst in case direct xmit path is usedDirect xmit does not use it since it calls dev_queue_xmit() to sendpackets, hence it calls dst_release(). kmemleak reports: unreferencedobject 0xffff88814f440900 (size 184): comm "softirq", pid 0, jiffies4294951896 hex dump (first 32 bytes): 00 60 5b 04 81 88 ff ff 00 e6 e8 82ff ff ff ff .`[............. 21 0b 50 82 ff ff ff ff 00 00 00 00 00 00 0000 !.P............. backtrace (crc cb2bf5d6): [<000000003ee17107>]kmem_cache_alloc+0x286/0x340 [<0000000021a5de2c>] dst_alloc+0x43/0xb0[<00000000f0671159>] rt_dst_alloc+0x2e/0x190 [<00000000fe5092c9>]__mkroute_output+0x244/0x980 [<000000005fb96fb0>]ip_route_output_flow+0xc0/0x160 [<0000000045367433>] nf_ip_route+0xf/0x30[<0000000085da1d8e>] nf_route+0x2d/0x60 [<00000000d1ecd1cb>]nft_flow_route+0x171/0x6a0 [nft_flow_offload] [<00000000d9b2fb60>]nft_flow_offload_eval+0x4e8/0x700 [nft_flow_offload] [<000000009f447dbb>]expr_call_ops_eval+0x53/0x330 [nf_tables] [<00000000072e1be6>]nft_do_chain+0x17c/0x840 [nf_tables] [<00000000d0551029>]nft_do_chain_inet+0xa1/0x210 [nf_tables] [<0000000097c9d5c6>]nf_hook_slow+0x5b/0x160 [<0000000005eccab1>] ip_forward+0x8b6/0x9b0[<00000000553a269b>] ip_rcv+0x221/0x230 [<00000000412872e5>]__netif_receive_skb_one_core+0xfe/0x110

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26834` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.13.0-16-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-extra-4.13.0-16-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-generic - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-37-lowlatency - 5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-kvm - 4.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1001-aws - 4.15.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.4.0-1018-aws - 5.4.0-1018.18~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1082-azure - 4.15.0-1082.92
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1020-azure - 5.4.0-1020.20~18.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-gcp - 4.15.0-1071.81
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1019-gcp - 5.4.0-1019.19~18.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1010-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-16.19').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
linux-kvm package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.2').
linux-aws package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1001.1').
